description:
The Draco Group (or Triplet) consists of the face-on spiral NGC 5985 (leftmost of the group in this image), the elliptical galaxy NGC 5982 (central) and the edge-on spiral NGC 5981 (right).  According to the Webb Deep-Sky Society website, the approximate distances to these galaxies are as follows: NGC 5985 - 120 million light years; NGC 5982 - 130 million years; and NGC 5981 - 100 million light years. 

Data for this image were collected on 31 March 2019 from a dual TEC 140 rig located at Les Granges, Olly Penrice's facility in the Haut Alpes, France.  

The image has been cropped to around 50% of the full-frame in order to focus on the triplet.

Capture Details:

Telescopes: TEC 140 x 2
Mount: Mesu 200
Cameras: Atik 460 (Lum); Moravian G2-8300 (RGB)

Lum: 20 x 900s
Red: 12 x 600s
Green: 12 x 600s
Blue: 12 x 600s

Total integration time: 11 hours

Data: Olly Penrice; Tom O'Donoghue; Elisabeth Milne; Steve Milne
Processing: Elisabeth Milne
title: The Draco Triplet
